channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13809] TestRowTooBig should use HDFS directory for its region directory
item.description:
TestRowTooBig uses local directory to create region, which does not work well in Windows, and the code path expects s DFS file path

java.lang.Exception: Unexpected exception, expected<org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RowTooBigException> but was<java.lang.IllegalArgumentException>

	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem.getPathName(DistributedFileSystem.java:197)

item.summary: TestRowTooBig should use HDFS directory for its region directory

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: createHRegion() is just a proxy, we don't need it. Actually, we should keep using the method name createRegionAndWAL to be explicit that it creates a region and a WAL (which is a recent cleanup).
You are right, createHRegion() is extra - V2 patch fixed this.
In branch-1, I chose to keep the createHRegion() so that we don't directly call HRegion code - keep the flexibility and hide the implementation.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12736243/HBASE-13809.v1-master.patch
against master branch at commit e0cf811b33d19d9aa6cd94298aea13d8ce981b14.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12736243

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 3 warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestReplicasClient

This message is automatically generated.
Both Javadoc and core tests are pre-exist.

Ted Yu, the HBaseTestingUtility#closeRegionAndWAL() and other methods were introduced in HBASE-12972. Andrew Purtell can comment why he did not port those changes to branch-1 when most other changes in master ported to branch-1 in March/April 2015.

No specific reason. Not strictly needed at the time?

Should HBaseTestingUtility#closeRegionAndWAL() be ported to branch-1 ?

I see no reason why not, if it will be a useful change.

Should HBaseTestingUtility#closeRegionAndWAL() be ported to branch-1 ?

It is coming from the clean up done in HBASE-11983. I would love to see that backported in branch-1.

Do you think that HTU.createLocalHRegion() is the actual root cause? If so all users of createLocalHRegion() would be affected, not just this test. We can do a follow up issue.

I've committed the v2 patch. Thanks Stephen.
